Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: ISC-4241 Data Science I or Instructor Permission

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Data visualization, modeling, and prediction. Big data and database management, Bayesian methods, and nonlinear models. Problems from industrial and complex domains using R and Python.

College.title: College
College.text: College of Engineering and Computer Science

Department.title: Department
Department.text: Department of Industrial Engineering and Management Systems

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: The basic tools, theory and practice of Data Science.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: ISC 4242, MAS 3105, STA 4164, all with grade of C(2.0) or better, or C.I.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Predictive Modeling, Overfitting and Data Tuning, Classification Models, Regression Models

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text:
Complete all of the following
Earn a minimum grade of C in each of the following: 
COP4283 - Data Science Programming (3)
ISC4242 - Data Science II (3)
ISC4311 - Predictive Analytics (3)
CIS4340 - Data Management Technology (3)
ISC4551 - Data Graphics and Visualization (3)
STA4724 - Big Data Analytics Methods (4)
 and senior standing in the Data Science BS major, or C.I.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Students work in teams to address data science problems in industry, government, and the non-profit sector.

College.title: College
College.text: College of Engineering and Computer Science

Department.title: Department
Department.text: Department of Industrial Engineering and Management Systems

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: Admission to an iSTEM sponsored program.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Study skills, faculty networking, exposure to STEM professionals.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Principles of graphical representations and visualization: frameworks, data preparation, types of visual presentations, modeling, interaction techniques, guidelines. Projects using R and GGPLOT2.

College.title: College
College.text: College of Engineering and Computer Science

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Study skills, faculty networking, exposure to STEM professionals, STEM shadowing experience.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: (PHY 2049C or PHY 2054C) and (CHM 2045C or CHS 1440) or C.I.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Nanoscience and Nanotechnology covers the basic principles governing nature at the nanoscale and summarizes the state of the art of emerging nanotechnology applications.

ISC3424 - Chemical and Life Science Nano.name: ISC3424 - Chemical and Life Science Nanotechnology

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: PR: 'C' (2.0 or better in CHS 1440 or CHM 2045C, or CI

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Synthesis, fabrication and properties of nanomaterials and nanodevices, and their broad applications in chemical/life science, environment protection and sustainability.

ISC2215 - Interdisciplinary Applications.name: ISC2215 - Interdisciplinary Applications of Calculus I

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Interdisciplinary applications of differential and integral calculus topics in MAC 2311C to the solution of concrete problems in science, mathematics, and engineering disciplines.

ISC2216 - Interdisciplinary Applications.name: ISC2216 - Interdisciplinary Applications of Calculus II

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Interdisciplinary applications of differential and integral calculus topics in MAC 2312 to the solution of concrete problems in science, mathematics, and engineering disciplines.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: (PHY 2049C or PHY 2054C) and (CHM 2045C or CHS 1440) or C.I.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Computational nanoscience covers the basic use of computational analysis for the study of nanoscience and related applications in nanotechnology.
